title: Dozens of states on alert for wind, snow as 2 storms sweep across US
description: Two storm systems moving across the U.S. have placed 26 states, from California to Kentucky, under snow and wind alerts.

title: Lack of Winter Olympic bids may lead to rotating fixed hosts
description: The dearth of candidates to host the Winter Olympics amid spiralling venue costs could force the IOC to resort to lining up a list of fixed, rotating hosts

title: Roslyn Pope, author of 'Appeal for Human Rights,' dies at 84
description: Roslyn Pope has died aged 84

title: Biden fires Architect of the Capitol over alleged abuses
description: President Joe Biden has fired the embattled Architect of the Capitol, the official who oversees the Capitol complex

title: COVID could create crisis in Alex Murdaugh murder trial
description: Two jurors in the double murder trial of disgraced South Carolina attorney Alex Murdaugh have COVID, leaving the future of the proceedings in some doubt as they enter their 16th day

title: Sheriff: Florida man fatally shoots clerk at Kentucky hotel
description: Authorities say a Florida man is accused of fatally shooting a clerk at a hotel in western Kentucky after assaulting two people outside the business who couldn’t give him a cigarette lighter

title: Feds probe United plane's December dip near ocean off Hawaii
description: Federal investigators are seeking more information about an incident in which a United Airlines plane dropped to within about 800 feet of the ocean surface after taking off from Hawaii

title: Washington Nationals owner Ted Lerner dies at 97
description: Longtime Washington Nationals owner Ted Lerner has died at the age of 97

title: WATCH:  Timelapse video shows Rihanna's halftime show setup and takedown
description: The Super Bowl halftime show was Rihanna's first live performance in seven years. The singer also surprised fans with a pregnancy reveal.

title: Significant portion of Chinese balloon payload recovered, US official says
description: A significant portion of the Chinese balloon payload has been recovered, a U.S. official told ABC News.

title: Camilla, the Queen Consort, tests positive for COVID
description: Camilla, the Queen Consort, has tested positive for COVID-19, according to Buckingham Palace.

title: U-Haul driver in custody after allegedly hitting pedestrians in Brooklyn: Sources
description: A U-Haul driver is in custody after allegedly striking pedestrians in the Brooklyn, New York, neighborhood of Bay Ridge.

title: Portions of Georgia grand jury report in 2020 election probe to be released this week
description: Portions of a report by the Georgia grand jury investigating efforts to overturn the results of the 2020 election will be released later this week, a judge has ruled.

title: Czech soccer player Jakub Jankto comes out as gay
description: Czech Republic international Jakub Jankto has posted a video on social media saying he is gay

title: China accuses US of flying spy balloons into its airspace
description: China on Monday accused the United States of flying more than 10 surveillance balloons into its airspace without permission last year, further escalating tensions.

title: Report: Companies' climate targets not what they claim to be
description: A new report says climate commitments by companies aren’t always as green as they seem

title: German ballet director suspended after feces attack
description: A German newspaper critic had animal feces smeared on her face by a ballet director in the city of Hannover after he apparently took offense at a review she wrote

title: After their genitals were cut, some women search for healing
description: A global target aims to eradicate the deeply entrenched practice of female genital cutting by 2030

title: Antisemitism worries rising for many U.S. Jews, survey finds
description: More than four in ten Jews in the United States feel their status in America is less secure than it was a year earlier

title: Super Bowl champion Nick Bolton talks scoop-and-score touchdown
description: Kansas City Chiefs linebacker Nick Bolton, who led the team in tackles and scored a defensive touchdown, talks about the Super Bowl win.

title: Kansas City officer shot, hurt after Chiefs' Super Bowl win
description: A Kansas City police officer has been hit by gunfire and wounded at the department’s headquarters shortly after the Chiefs won the Super Bowl

title: De La Soul co-founder Trugoy the Dove dead at 54
description: David Jude Jolicoeur, known widely as Trugoy the Dove and one of the founding members of the Long Island hip-hop trio De La Soul, has died

title: Train derailment prompts water utility to take precautions
description: A West Virginia water utility says it's taking precautionary steps following the derailment of a train hauling chemicals that later sent up a toxic plume in Ohio

title: New Hampshire Supreme Court will consider challenge to Pamela Smart's life sentence
description: It will be the first time Pamela Smart has been able to challenge the repeated denials for her release from prison.

title: WATCH:  Meteor lights up skies over England
description: Onlookers captured video of a meteor as it streaked through the skies over England.

title: Georgia man charged with impersonating CIA officer
description: Robert Earhart Jr. was an agent with the CIA's "protective operations division" with a top-secret security clearance, and he needed a meeting with the DOJ.

title: Workers await as NJ lawmakers debate casino smoking ban
description: For years, some New Jersey lawmakers have introduced bills that would ban smoking in Atlantic City's casinos

title: UK to review security after unknown objects puzzle N America
description: Britain has announced a security review after several unidentified objects were shot down in the skies over North America

title: Nuclear-armed Pakistan reaches for IMF loan to avoid default
description: Officials and analysts say nuclear-armed and cash-strapped Pakistan will impose billions in new taxes to court a massive bailout, but they warned the move could cause inflation to escalate

title: Alleged hazing incident prompts suspension of men's college basketball program
description: The New Mexico State University's men's basketball program has been suspended for the rest of the season amid an investigation into into an alleged hazing incident.

title: EU foresees economy improving, but inflation still painful
description: Europe's economic prospects are looking up, at least a little

title: Portugal church sex abuse study finds 512 alleged victims
description: A committee that has been examining historic child sex abuse in Portuguese Catholic Church says 512 alleged victims have come forward

title: Australia adds $300 million in funding for Indigenous pledge
description: Fifteen years after the Australian Parliament’s historic apology to its Indigenous people for past wrongs, the government is announcing roughly $300 million in new funding to improve the lives of Australia’s original inhabitants

title: Death penalty phase of trial looms for NYC bike path killer
description: A jury on Monday will begin considering whether an Islamic extremist should be sentenced to death for killing eight people people on a New York City bike path

title: Asian stocks slide ahead of US inflation update
description: Asian stock markets are lower ahead of a U.S. inflation update that traders worry might lead to more interest rate hikes

title: Philippines: China ship hits Filipino crew with laser light
description: China claims the South China Sea virtually in its entirety.

title: Super Bowl magic: Mahomes, Chiefs beat Eagles 38-35
description: Harrison Butker kicked a 27-yard field goal with 8 seconds left.

title: Israeli jets hit militant site in Gaza after rocket attack
description: Gaza Strip residents say Israeli aircraft launched a series of airstrikes.

title: Pope worried about Nicaraguan bishop sentenced to 26 years
description: An outspoken critic of the Nicaraguan government sentenced to 26 years in prison

title: Millions at risk as dangerous winds and tornadoes a possibility in US
description: More than 40 million Americans are at risk of experiencing storms this week, as a severe weather outbreak is possible in various parts of the U.S.
